author: protolambda
content: proposer slashings have two headers in them, and that header contains the proposer index already. And it's always the same for both headers. So no need to add it another time to the slashing container

author: protolambda
content: yes, or well, proposer_index was introduced in the header around the same time, since it makes a lot of processing things easier. It is then later verified by calculating the actual proposer index.

author: protolambda
content: So with that change, it also made sense to update the slashing to not contain duplicate information

author: djrtwo
content: the whistleblower concept is for message types in phase 1 where the whistleblower can in fact be different than the proposer (primarily due ot the multi-round game element of proof of custody games)
